snippet: With the majority of candidates abiding by spending caps in exchange for participating in the city’s matching-fund program, any outside financing could make a difference.
abstract: Outside groups pour estimated $3 million into supporting and opposing their preferred Democratic candidates one week before New York City mayoral primary; effect of expenditures are being closely watched, because this is first citywide election in which outside groups have had opportunity to spend unlimited amounts on campaigns in wake of United States Supreme Court's decision in Citizens United case.
lead_paragraph: With the majority of candidates abiding by spending caps in exchange for participating in the city’s matching-fund program, any outside financing could make a difference.

headline.main: Outside Groups Have Spent $3 Million on Mayor’s Race
headline.print_headline: Outside Groups Have Spent $3 Million on Mayor’s Race

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
